metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.code_html:
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      counter: 0
    }
  },
  renderTriggered(evt) {
    console.log("renderTriggered: ",evt)
    alert("renderTriggered");
  }
}

content.text: The renderTriggered lifecycle hook runs when a tracked reactive component changes, and therefore triggers a new render, so that the screen gets updated with the latest changes.
content.html: The renderTriggered lifecycle hook runs when a tracked reactive component changes, and therefore triggers a new render, so that the screen gets updated with the latest changes.

content.text: The renderTriggered hook is meant to be used in debugging, and is only available in development mode.
content.html: The renderTriggered hook is meant to be used in debugging, and is only available in development mode.

content.text: A reactive component is a component that can change.
content.html: A reactive component is a component that can change.

content.text: A render function is a function compiled by Vue that keeps track of reactive components. When a reactive component changes, the render function is triggered and re-renders the application to the screen.
content.html: A render function is a function compiled by Vue that keeps track of reactive components. When a reactive component changes, the render function is triggered and re-renders the application to the screen.
